> I don't like that mix too, but what I can't see is how I can 
> bound an instance of MyClass (which already exists when the 
> test runs) to a instance of TestMyClass which are launched by 
> the TestRunner. 

> My problem is that I can't use the 'new' 
> operator to create instances of MyClass inside TestMyClass 
> because I'm tied to the framework factory method. 

are these factory methods static or not ?

If instance methods: You would have some class of the framework you can
instantiate in your setUp() and then call the factory method.

If static: "big problem" (design wise, I find), but seriously, in your setUp
you just copy anything you have to do to create MyClass in other
circumstances. In your production code you have to create an instance to,
one way or the other.

Might be something like this:

public void setUp(){
	framework = MotherOfAllFrameworks.getInstance();
	// or = new MotherOfAllFrameworks(...);
	myInstance = framework.create(...);
}

> it could fit. Even more, I should practice more with complex 
> structures in Java to get fluency in my designs - the 
> beginnings are always hard :-).
